metadata.title: CVE-2021-29967 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 88 andFirefox ESR 78.11. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort some of these could have beenexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird <78.11, Firefox < 89, and Firefox ESR < 78.11.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 89.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 89.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 89.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
